definition: see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: March 8th was first celebrated as the International Women's Day in 1975.
sentences.chinese: 1975年，联合国开始庆祝“三八”国际妇女节。

sentences.english: Today we gather here to grandly celebrate the International Women's Day.
sentences.chinese: 今天我们汇聚一堂，隆重庆祝三八国际妇女节。

sentences.english: Today is International Women's Day and send the best greetings and wishes to all the women.
sentences.chinese: 今天是国际妇女节，向所有的女同胞送去问候和祝福。

sentences.english: In this sense, the International Women's Day not only belongs to women but also to all people of the world.
sentences.chinese: 三八国际妇女节不仅属于女性，也属于所有人。

sentences.english: 1911 - International Women's Day is celebrated for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 1911年的今天，第一个国际妇女节。

sentences.english: We celebrate International Women's Day on March 8th.
sentences.chinese: 我们在三月八日庆祝国际妇女节。

definition: Liberation Day/cf Japan's surrender on 15th August 1945, celebrated as Liberation Day in Korea
Youth Day (May 4th), PRC national holiday for young people aged 14 to 28, who get half a day off
see 建軍節|建军节[Jian4 jun1 jie2]
Arbor Day (March 12th), also known as National Tree Planting Day 全民義務植樹日|全民义务植树日[Quan2 min2 Yi4 wu4 Zhi2 shu4 ri4]
(formal) birthday/anniversary of the founding of an organization
